hero.title: How LegalHelp AI is Transforming Legal Document Processing
hero.subtitle: Legal and notarial organizations operate in environments where accuracy, consistency, and professional responsibility are critical.
hero.intro: Assistive AI applied to document processing emerges as a practical response to this challenge, designed to support professional judgment and improve operational efficiency.

structuralChallenge.title: The structural challenge of legal document flows
content: Legal work depends on extensive, heterogeneous, and legally binding documents.
workflows based on documents, contracts, deeds, and powers of attorney remain essential, but increasingly difficult to scale through manual processes.
According to the Legal Technology & AI Adoption Report by AllRize, more than 60% of legal firms already integrate AI tools into their tech stacks, although full integration remains a challenge. [1]

genericAiNotEnough.title: Why generic AI is not enough
content: The OECD AI Policy Observatory underscores that AI in regulated sectors must be designed with explicit human accountability. [2]

howItWorks.title: How LegalHelp AI by DocumentoIQ works
howItWorks.content: LegalHelp AI was designed specifically for legal and notarial documents, focusing on real workflows:

ocr.title: Advanced OCR for complex documents
ocr.description: LegalHelp AI processes scanned and digital documents, including those with complex layouts or variable quality.

languageUnderstanding.title: Understanding legal language
languageUnderstanding.description: The system applies language models adapted to legal terminology and document structures, allowing precise identification of entities, dates, monetary values, and legal actions.

extraction.title: Structured information extraction
extraction.description: Relevant information is converted into structured results that can be reviewed, validated, and integrated into downstream systems.

humanInTheLoop.title: Integrated human review (human-in-the-loop)
humanInTheLoop.description: A visual review interface ensures that professionals validate extracted data before it is used operationally, preserving accountability.

howItWorks.conclusion: As part of DocumentoIQ, LegalHelp AI allows scaling legal document processing while maintaining traceability, regulatory compliance, and operational control.

strategicImplications.title: Strategic implications
content: The report AI Adoption Surges in the Legal Industry highlights that around 74% of legal professionals plan to use AI tools in their roles in the coming year, underscoring the importance of document automation. [3]
For executives, notaries, and legal leaders:
• Effective AI is built at the application level
• AI must be integrated into real processes

finalConclusion.title: Conclusion
content: LegalHelp AI demonstrates how responsibly applied AI can transform legal document processing without substituting professional judgment. The combination of technology, processes, and human validation is the foundation of sustainable adoption.
